page.description: Tabbed dialogs allow you to organize your dialog into logical sections, and to pack a lot more information onto the dialog than a single dialog would allow.
page.syntax: {TAB= [ %Directives% ] Variable_Name [ ! Event_Name ] }{PANE= Description1 [ ? Condition1 ] } ... {PANE= Description2 [ ? Condition2 ] } ... {PANE= DescriptionN [ ? ConditionN ] } ... {ENDTAB}

argument.name: %Directives%
argument.description: Character. Refer to Xdialog Language Directives and Operators.

argument.name: Variable_Name
argument.description: Character. A variable that is set to the name of the current tab. You can also control which tab has initial focus by setting the value of Variable_Name before the dialog is open.

argument.name: Event_Name
argument.description: Character. Optional. Refer to Event Syntax.

argument.name: Description1 ... DescriptionN
argument.description: Character. The labels (and the names) of the tab pages.
